body:
## What's Changed
* drop swift 5.9, support swift 6 only by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/42
  * also update bazel deps for rules_swift 3.0


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/1.4.0...1.4.1

## What's Changed
* Introduce a mechanism for automatic retry on 500-code server errors by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/31
* support api spec 4.0 by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/43
* Move retry strategies to public func by @simonpierreroy in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/44


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/1.3.0...1.4.0

## What's Changed
* app store connect api 3.8 by @aaronsky in 08f081f5efc1d61aae3c626f501bd3dad7f649da

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/1.2.1...1.3.0

## What's Changed
* Fix crash when building with Bazel 8 by @jpsim in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/40
* support bazel 8 by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/41

## New Contributors
* @jpsim made their first contribution in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/40

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/1.2.0...1.2.1

## What's Changed
* app store connect api 3.7 by @aaronsky in 0d39449aa6d781f20baa83ba608d5a93bb72b452

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/1.1.0...1.2.0

## What's Changed
* app store connect api 3.6 by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/39


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/1.0.1...1.1.0

## What's Changed

* Fix tests and a crash under linux and swift 6 by @simonpierreroy in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/38

## New Contributors

* @simonpierreroy made their first contribution in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/38

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/1.0.0...1.0.1

The big deal in this release is support for the newly revealed [Enterprise Program API](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/enterpriseprogramapi) from Apple. Due to the size and scope of this release, I have decided to make this the first release with a non-zero major version, and commit to semver going forward. This will be in alpha for a little bit while I test all the new API, so please consider sharing your feedback!

## Breaking Changes

- Generated API modules have been relocated in the build to depend on the `AppStoreConnect` target and are no longer exported. Additionally, the `_Specification` private module was renamed to `AppStoreAPI` and made public. You will likely need to add `import AppStoreAPI` to many locations where you also `import AppStoreConnect` in order to import both the client layer (`AppStoreConnect`) and the API layer (`AppStoreAPI`). You may also be able to replace some of those `AppStoreConnect` imports with `AppStoreAPI`.
- The `AppStoreConnect` product in the `Package.swift` now refers to a grouping of the `AppStoreConnect` and `AppStoreAPI` targets. To use the Enterprise Program API, you can add a dependency on the product named `EnterpriseProgram`. Depending on both in a singular target is also supported.
- The `Authenticator` protocol now exposes a `API` readonly property. The `API` type contains information used by the client layer to determine the hostname and token audience used to perform requests. For the best downstream experience, set a default for your users (the built-in `JWT` authenticator uses `.appStoreConnect` as its default API).
- Alpha-casing of special-cases of `.iOS`, `.macOS`, etc. as well as `.minussomethingVar` in the `Sort` enums on Paths have been adjusted for improved readability. (#29)
- Swift 5.9 is now the minimum required Swift tools version.
- iOS 16, macOS 13, tvOS 16, and watchOS 9 are now the minimum required versions when targeting these platforms. (#32)

## New Features

- App Store Connect API has been updated for [version 3.5](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appstoreconnectapi/app_store_connect_api_release_notes/app_store_connect_api_3_5_release_notes) (#17)
- Enterprise Program API support has been introduced to the library at [version 1.0](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/enterpriseprogramapi/enterprise-api-1-0-release-notes) (#22)
- Bazel support has been added to the build, and asc-swift is available on the Bazel Central Registry (#27)

## The Rest

- Various fixes to prepare for compatibility with the Swift 6 language mode (#26)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.6.1...1.0.0

name: 1.0.0rc2
body:
## What's Changed
* bump baselines to iOS 16, macOS 13, etc by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/32
* fix up docs and clean up Transport some by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/33


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/1.0.0rc1...1.0.0rc2

name: 1.0.0rc1
body:
## What's Changed
* Adjusts alpha-casing of fields, enum-cases, and type names in many special situations by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/29
* add a couple of missing user roles to enterprise by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/30


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/1.0.0-alpha.2...1.0.0rc1

name: 1.0.0-alpha.2
body: **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/1.0.0-alpha.1...1.0.0-alpha.2

name: 1.0.0-alpha.1
body:
## What's Changed
* support api spec 3.5 by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/17
* bump CI to Swift 5.10 by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/18
* !!breaking change: renamed _Specification to AppStoreAPI by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/20
* !!breaking change: invert the dependency between the generated API spec and client by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/21
* !!breaking change: support the enterprise program API v1.0 by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/22
* addressed warnings in Swift 5.10 that arise from Swift 6 upcoming features by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/23
* restored upload operation tests by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/24
* make an API coexistence sample by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/25
* preparing for swift 6 compat by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/26
* Support Bazel for hermetic builds by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/27
* Create a release pipeline for BCR by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/28


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.6.1...1.0.0-alpha.1

## What's Changed
* update for 3.4.2 spec by @aaronsky in e0ed696401ceeb4454e5c8b357df1365e0ea028a

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.6.0...0.6.1

## What's Changed
* Feature: Entity type ID shorthand by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/2
* Tag all generated types as Sendable where possible by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/16
* update for 3.4.1 spec by @aaronsky in 655cc8dad78149cc9e645a2058d0dfcba0660b67

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.5.0...0.6.0

## What's Changed
* Support API spec 3.4 by @aaronsky in https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/15


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.4.2...0.5.0

## What's Changed
* support [API spec 3.3](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appstoreconnectapi/app_store_connect_api_release_notes/app_store_connect_api_3_3_release_notes)
* update CI to Xcode 15.2 and new macos-14 runners (https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/pull/13)


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.4.1...0.4.2

Fixes a small bug in the spec where UserRole was missing an undocumented case. (#12)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.4.0...0.4.1

This is a minor release that brings the supported API specification to version 3.2.

There is a breaking change in the generated files, being that types are no longer `Hashable`. Also, the version of swift-crypto used by the library was updated to [3.2.0](https://github.com/apple/swift-crypto/releases/tag/3.2.0).

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.3.1...0.4.0

This release brings the supported API specification to version 3.1. 

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.3.0...0.3.1

This is a minor release that brings the supported API specification to version 2.4. 

* The generated spec sources was updated to version 2.2, then 2.3, and now 2.4. 
* `AppStoreConnectClient.pages` was made `nonisolated` in a0ecab8
* Several new tests were added to make the library more robust

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.2.0...0.3.0

This is a minor release that improves documentation and testing across the package. 

There is a breaking change in the generated files, being that structured options are no longer how you call the path methods.  This reduces the binary size and compilation time of the library by a modest amount. It should be relatively simple to migrate, particularly given the age of the project so far.

Before:
```swift
func get(parameters: GetParameters? = nil) -> Request<AppInfoResponse>
```

After:
```swift
func get(fieldsAppInfos: [FieldsAppInfos]? = nil, include: [Include]? = nil, fieldsAgeRatingDeclarations: [FieldsAgeRatingDeclarations]? = nil, fieldsAppInfoLocalizations: [FieldsAppInfoLocalizations]? = nil, fieldsAppCategories: [FieldsAppCategories]? = nil, limitAppInfoLocalizations: Int? = nil) -> Request<AppInfoResponse>
```

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/compare/0.1.0...0.2.0

This is the initial release! This library is capable of hitting every publicly-documented surface of the App Store Connect API, version 2.1. It is also one of the only Swift libraries of its kind for hitting this API that works on Linux, so it's suitable for lightweight CI environments. Please file an [issue](https://github.com/aaronsky/asc-swift/issues) if you run into any trouble!
